text:
Hi all, I'm assuming this is a derpy question, but I have no idea how to get the names for multiselect value in a hubdb table to use in a module?
`{% for row in table %}`
    `<div class="feature {{ row.section }}">` 
      `<strong>{{ row.name }}</strong><br>`
      `{{ row.feature_description }}<br>`
      `{{ row.section.name }} {# "section" is multiselect, how do i get these names? #}`
    `</div>`
  `{% endfor %}`

the multiselect value is an array, so you should do:
`{% for value in row.section %}` 
  `{{ value.name }}` 
`{% endfor %}`
Has anyone used a filter method to find within a string? I’m trying to find a word in a url string but I don’t know which filter or function would be the best for this. Thanks

Hi,

I am creating a website using "HTML + HubL Templates", is there a possibility to set different padding and margin values for sections as in pages built on themes?

Hi <@U01C8C0DAAC>,
As I can see, you're working with HTML + HubL template ( Non-theme ) based template. It's not possible to directly appending padding and other design related stuff for that page.

This feature works with theme.
Hey <@U01RBF0UXD0>, does it have to be filter? You could use `{{ request.path is string_containing 'word' }}` .

question for HubSpot Video 2.0. I know you can grab the HubL snippet from the file manager. Can you use a normal text module in order for the tracking to still work? or do we still have to stick with the Richtext or Video module?
Hey everyone - curious if folks know of variables similar to  `content.subcategory`  but for detecting system pages exclusively and not just by template name / meta. Thanks in advance!
